titleStmt.title: The law and light within the most sure rule or light, which sheweth the right use and end of the Scripture, manifested in opposition to several false principles inserted in a book intitled Scripture light the most sure light, by William Bridge, the great pastor and Reverend Father, so accounted, of the Church at Yarmouth in Norfolk / confuted by George Whitehead.
titleStmt.author: Whitehead, George, 1636?-1723.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A65872 of text R39128 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing W1940). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 21 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 5 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.
